---
title: Privacy
sidebar:
  order: 3
slug: wordpress/forms/privacy
---

Privacy forms are used to let your customer request either the export or the removal of their data, according to GDPR rules.
There are so 2 types of forms that you can find below.


### Export Data

This form allows your users to send an "Export data request".

> To declare an export form, set as **Form Name** the value **Export**.  The form must contain only one input **type email** and a **submit button**!

You can just copy the element below for an example of an Export form.

<copy-element name="Export Data Form"></copy-element>

The user will receive a confirmation email, while you will find the **Export data request** on your WordPress dashboard following the path *Tools » Export Personal Data*. You will need to confirm the data export request from there.


### Erase Data

This form allows your users to send an "Erase data request".

> To declare an erase data form, set as **Form Name** the value **Erase Data**.  The form must contain only one input **type email** and a **submit button**!

You can just copy the element below for an example of an Export form.

<copy-element name="Erase Data Form"></copy-element>

The user will receive a confirmation email, while you will find the **Erase data request** on your WordPress dashboard following the path *Tools » Erase Personal Data*. You will need to confirm the data removal request from there.
